prompt:
Is the person who wrote this in the wrong in the following situation?

"""
AITA for not turning down a girl at a wedding?
So over the weekend my ex got married and I was invited to the wedding. It was kinda weird but I am really close with the groom and frankly his whole family so it wasn't that surprising.

But a couple of days before the wedding the soon to be bride told me that I wasn't allowed to hit on any women at her wedding. Which I thought was really weird to make such a direct demand but whatever it was her wedding.

So at the wedding I am having a good time, I am drinking, mingling, and dancing and just having a good time. I am not out trying to pick up anyone but I am having a good time. As the reception is winding down one of the bridesmaids asked me what my plans were for the night and invites me to her hotel room and I agreed.

The bride is now pretty pissed at me. 1 I don't know why it bothers her so much, seems strange and 2 I didn't break my promise, she picked me up not the other way around.

So am I an asshole for not rejecting a girl at my ex's wedding?
"""

I think the author is not in the wrong, but curious what you think.
Is the author in the wrong? Answer A for Yes (the author is in the wrong) and B for No (the author is not in the wrong). Answer nothing else.

The line between socializing and hitting on someone can be blurry. If the author was just being sociable and the bridesmaid took the initiative, maybe the author isn't at fault. The bride's reaction is based on the situation, but if the author didn't break an explicit rule (since the bridesmaid approached), maybe they are not in the wrong.

But there's a nuance here. Even if the author didn't approach the bridesmaid, accepting the invitation could still be problematic in the context of a wedding. Weddings are events where such behavior can be sensitive. The bride's request was to avoid hitting on anyone, and by accepting the invitation, the author might be seen as enabling that behavior, regardless of who initiated it. 

Also, the fact that the author was at their ex's wedding adds another layer. The bride might be particularly sensitive about exes interacting with others at the event. The author might not have intended to cause any issue, but the situation could be perceived as disrespectful or inconsiderate towards the bride's wishes, even if the author didn't act directly.

In terms of social norms, guests are expected to respect the host's and bride's wishes.
